page.title: 17OUNDLE, THE NENE AND BOATS
page.content:
{ FAIRLINE BOATS}AND{OUNDLE MARINA
These two firms are based on a former gravel pit next to the River Nene immediately south of Oundle on the A 605. In 1964 a small business was begun which employed six people to run the marina as the gravel pit was developed and to fit out GRP mouldings as small river cruisers.After 18 months the company began to mould their own hulls. The two concerns are now separate; the Marina provides moorings and facilities for river boats; Fairline Marine builds luxury motor cruisers. The site covers 25 acres.
GRP - glass reinforced plastic
